title: Japan’s moon lander forced to power down but may yet be revived
summary: Japan’s SLIM lander has been forced to power down on the moon with its solar cells unable to catch sunlight, but hope remains that the spacecraft can be reactivated.

title: CNES-Led Consortium Begins Development of Atomic Accelerometers
summary:
French space agency CNES announced 16 January that it had kicked off Phase A of its CARIOQA initiative, which aims to develop an atomic accelerometer. An accelerometer is simply a tool that measures the acceleration of a body or object. When flown aboard a spacecraft, these sensors can help us measure Earth’s gravity field. These […]
The post CNES-Led Consortium Begins Development of Atomic Accelerometers appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Sierra Space tests full-scale inflatable module
summary: Sierra Space has successfully tested a full-scale version of an inflatable module it is developing for commercial space stations.

title: Redwire to provide components for Blue Ring transfer vehicle
summary: Redwire will provide solar panels and other components for Blue Ring, an orbital transfer vehicle under development by Blue Origin.

title: What happens when an astronaut in orbit says he’s not coming back?
summary: "If you guys don't give me a chance to repair my instrument, I'm not going back."
